verses.roman:
tathāpi yavana jāti, nā kari pratīti
tīrtha-yātrāya eta saṅghaṭṭa bhāla nahe rīti

synonyms: tathāpi—still; yavana jāti—by caste a Muslim; nā—does not; kari—do; pratīti—confidence; tīrtha-yātrāya—in going for a pilgrimage; eta—so; saṅghaṭṭa—crowd; bhāla—good; nahe—not; rīti—etiquette.
translation: "Although the King is respectful toward You, he still belongs to the yavana class and should not be believed. We think that there is no need for such a great crowd to accompany You on Your pilgrimage to Vṛndāvana.
